Overview.Title: Pre-Quiz
Overview.Text: Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Darfur is in what region?

QuestionContent.Text: Darfur is in what region?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Through the genocide in Darfur how many have been estimated of being displaced from their homes?

QuestionContent.Text: Through the genocide in Darfur how many have been estimated of being displaced from their homes?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: How many civilians of Darfur have been murdered?

QuestionContent.Text: How many civilians of Darfur have been murdered?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What is said to be the main cause of the conflict?

QuestionContent.Text: What is said to be the main cause of the conflict?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What year did the rebellion begin in Darfur?

QuestionContent.Text: What year did the rebellion begin in Darfur?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What has been the number one killer to civilians in Darfur?

QuestionContent.Text: What has been the number one killer to civilians in Darfur?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: How is the region in Darfur divided?

QuestionContent.Text: How is the region in Darfur divided?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What group is referred to as Devils on horseback?

QuestionContent.Text: What group is referred to as Devils on horseback?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What group are mostly Arab militias, supported by the government of Sudan, who conduct vicious attacks largely against non-Arab Darfurians?

QuestionContent.Text: What group are mostly Arab militias, supported by the government of Sudan, who conduct vicious attacks largely against non-Arab Darfurians?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: How many other Darifiran rebel groups are struggling to find unity and a common negotiating position to bring up against the government of Sudan, in spite of recent unity preceding the Libyan peace talks?

QuestionContent.Text: How many other Darifiran rebel groups are struggling to find unity and a common negotiating position to bring up against the government of Sudan, in spite of recent unity preceding the Libyan peace talks?

Overview.Title: Survey
Overview.Text: Please answer the following questions to the best of your ability.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Gender

QuestionContent.Text: What is your gender?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What is your age?

QuestionContent.Text: What is your age?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: How many years have you been playing video games?

QuestionContent.Text: How many years have you been playing video games?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Fun games can be educational

QuestionContent.Text: Fun games can be educational.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Most fun games are educational

QuestionContent.Text: Most fun games are educational.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Games are more fun when they are cooperative (instead of competitive)

QuestionContent.Text: Games are more fun when they are cooperative (instead of competitive).

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Games are more fun when you play by yourself (instead of with others).

QuestionContent.Text: Games are more fun when you play by yourself (instead of with others).

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Games are more fun when you play online (instead of with others in the same room).

QuestionContent.Text: Games are more fun when you play online (instead of with others in the same room).

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Educational games can be fun.

QuestionContent.Text: Educational games can be fun.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Most educational games are fun.

QuestionContent.Text: Most educational games are fun.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Games are more educational when they are cooperative (instead of competitive).

QuestionContent.Text: Games are more educational when they are cooperative (instead of competitive).

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Games are more educational when you play by yourself (instead of with others).

QuestionContent.Text: Games are more educational when you play by yourself (instead of with others).

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Games are more educational when you play online (instead of with others in the same room).

QuestionContent.Text: Games are more educational when you play online (instead of with others in the same room).

QuestionContent.Text: List some fun games.

Overview.Title: Game
Overview.Text: For the following questions, please refer to this game.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Low game resource penalty for failure

QuestionContent.Title: Low game resource penalty for failure
QuestionContent.Text: If the player fails, how many game resources do they lose?

Selection.Text: Game resource penalty is extreme (e.g. restart the game)
Game resource penalty is large (e.g. 1/3 lives, 10 health points / 100)
Game resource penalty is nonexistent (e.g. unlimited lives)

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Low ”reset time” for failure (time to return to failure point)

QuestionContent.Title: Low ”reset time” for failure (time to return to failure point)
QuestionContent.Text: If the player fails, how long is the wait until they restart play?

Selection.Text: Reset time is very long (e.g. reloading level takes a long time)
Reset time is long (e.g. greater than 10 seconds)
Reset time is moderate (e.g. up to 10 seconds)
Reset time is short (e.g. a few seconds)
Reset time is very short (e.g. near instant)

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Content of Game Encyclopedia

QuestionContent.Title: Content of Game Encyclopedia
QuestionContent.Text: If this game contains an encyclopedia of game content, what kind of content does it contain?

Selection.Text: Game contains no encyclopedia or Encyclopedia contains no content
Encyclopedia contains content only related to game mechanics
Encyclopedia contains information about game mechanics, and also limited historical/factual information
Encyclopedia contains content related to game mechanics and historical/factual information
Encyclopedia contains content related to game mechanics and historical/factual information and outside links or references

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Amount of Referential Material

QuestionContent.Title: Amount of Referential Material
QuestionContent.Text: How many game objects or events reference real-life objects or events?

Selection.Text: No game objects or events are references to real-life objects or events
At least one event or object is a reference to a real-world event or object
Several non-connected events or objects are references to a real-world event or object
At least one group of objects or events are references to real-life objects or events
Numerous groups of objects or events are references to real-life objects or events

Question.QuestionIdentifier: High checkpoint frequency

QuestionContent.Title: High checkpoint frequency
QuestionContent.Text: How often are there in-game checkpoints?

Selection.Text: Checkpoints are few and far between (e.g. levels are the only places to restart)
Checkpoints are numerous (e.g. players can restart at the beginning of each puzzle)
Checkpoints are frequent (e.g. players can restart part of the way through puzzles)

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Popularity of Referential Material

QuestionContent.Title: Popularity of Referential Material
QuestionContent.Text: Of the objects/events that are in the game, how recognizable/popular are they?

Selection.Text: Some of the references are popular
About half of the references are popular
Many of the references are popular
Most or all of the references are popular

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Freedom of exploration

QuestionContent.Title: Freedom of exploration
QuestionContent.Text: How much freedom of choice is there in the game, including both game world and choice of lessons?

Selection.Text: Players are placed in a strictly linear world or lesson progression
Players are allowed just a few large-scale choices in their game world
Players have the option to make choices about the direction of their progression in the world, but it is largely linear
Players can choose from many choices within the game world to explore, including lessons
Players are free to choose the direction they want, both edu- cationally and within the game world; allowed to jump between parallel lessons

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Iterative feedback

QuestionContent.Title: Iterative feedback
QuestionContent.Text: How much and how often is there feedback regarding progress on the game?

Selection.Text: Game gives no feedback other than high-level progression through the game
Game gives feedback after each level
Game gives feedback at various points through a level, after a series of puzzles
Game gives feedback after each puzzle
Game constantly gives feedback (e.g. during a puzzle)

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Rewards for knowing Referential Material

QuestionContent.Title: Rewards for knowing Referential Material
QuestionContent.Text: How much does knowing the real-life objects/events a↵ect the gameplay?

Selection.Text: Knowing the referential material is purely irrelevant; doesn’t affect the gameplay at all
Knowing the referential material is a little useful; only affects the gameplay a small amount
Knowing the referential material is somewhat useful; moderately affects the player’s choices during gameplay
Knowing the referential material is very useful; usually affects the player’s choices
Knowing the referential material always significantly affects gameplay

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Location of Game Encyclopedia

QuestionContent.Title: Location of Game Encyclopedia
QuestionContent.Text: Does this game have an encyclopedia of game content? If so, where?

Selection.Text: Game contains no encyclopedia of game content
Game information is located online, in a non-central location
Game has an outside manual (or wiki) of game content
Game doesn’t have an in-game encyclopedia, but points to a central location elsewhere
Game has an in-game encyclopedia of game content

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Unorthodox problem solving

QuestionContent.Title: Unorthodox problem solving
QuestionContent.Text: Are problems able to be solved multiple ways, or circumvented entirely?

Selection.Text: There is only one way to solve any given problem, with one given progression that is valid as a solution
Some problems within the game may be solved more than one way
Multiple solutions are available for each problem, but players are limited to using one of those solutions
Players can solve each problem via any solution, so long as they do not circumvent it
Players can solve a problem any way they like, or even circumvent the problem, and be given full (or bonus) points

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Adaptive Difficulty

QuestionContent.Title: Adaptive Difficulty
QuestionContent.Text: How many difficulty levels are there in the game, and how is the difficulty changed?

Selection.Text: Game has several difficulties, but players can only select difficulty at beginning of game
Game has several difficulties, and players can change difficulty mid-game
Game has several difficulties, and prompts the player to increase or decrease the difficulty as needed
Game has several difficulties, and automatically adjusts the difficulty of the game as needed

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Contextual Tutorials

QuestionContent.Title: Contextual Tutorials
QuestionContent.Text: How often are tutorials offered in the game?

Selection.Text: Tutorials aren’t given in the game
Tutorials are given at the beginning of the game
Tutorials are given every few levels/sections of the game
Tutorials are given at the beginning of every level/section

Question.QuestionIdentifier: This game was fun.

QuestionContent.Text: This game was fun.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: I had fun playing this game.

QuestionContent.Text: I had fun playing this game.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: This game was educational.

QuestionContent.Text: This game was educational.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: I learned something from playing this game.

QuestionContent.Text: I learned something from playing this game.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: What did you learn from playing this game?

QuestionContent.Text: What did you learn from playing this game?

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Provide some comments and feedback on the game.

QuestionContent.Text: Provide some comments and feedback on the game.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Provide some comments and feedback on this survey.

QuestionContent.Text: Provide some comments and feedback on this survey.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Estimate the number of minutes that you've played this game.

QuestionContent.Text: Estimate the number of minutes that you've played this game.

Question.QuestionIdentifier: Enter your score/farthest level from your play session.

QuestionContent.Text: Enter your highest score/farthest level from your play session.
